<td valign="middle" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1.58%;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="middle" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>
<td valign="middle" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:22.1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000636" name="us-gaap:DerivativeFairValueOfDerivativeNet" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapBalanceSheetLocationAxis_us-gaapOtherAssetsMember_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapCrossCurrencyInterestRateContractMember_20191231" decimals="-3" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">3,278</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="middle" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">)</p></td>
</tr>
</table></div></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:12pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company has structured its cross-currency swap agreement to be 100% effective and, as a result, there was no net impact to earnings resulting from hedge ineffectiveness. Changes in the fair value of the cross-currency swap designated as a hedging instrument that effectively offsets the variability of cash flows are reported in AOCI. These amounts subsequently are reclassified into the consolidated income statement in the same period in which the related hedged item affects earnings. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">For the three and nine months ended December 31, 2019, the Company recorded a $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000637" name="us-gaap:OtherNonoperatingGainsLosses" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapCrossCurrencyInterestRateContractMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000638" name="us-gaap:OtherNonoperatingGainsLosses" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapCrossCurrencyInterestRateContractMember_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">0.4</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> million in other income, net, included in the consolidated statements of operations related to the interest rate differential of the cross-currency swaps. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Contingent Consideration</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s contingent consideration consists of potentially payable amount related to the acquisition of ECP Entwicklungsgesellschaft mbH, or ECP, and AIS GmbH Aachen Innovative Solutions, or AIS, in July 2014. The Company acquired ECP and AIS for $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000639" name="us-gaap:PaymentsToAcquireBusinessesGross" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapBusinessAcquisitionAxis_abmdEcpEntwicklungsgesellschaftMbHAndAisGmbhAachenInnovativeSolutionsMember_20140702_20140731" decimals="-5" scale="6">13.0</ix:nonFraction> million in cash, with additional potential payouts totaling $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000640" name="us-gaap:BusinessCombinationContingentConsiderationArrangementsRangeOfOutcomesValueHigh" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapBusinessAcquisitionAxis_abmdEcpEntwicklungsgesellschaftMbHAndAisGmbhAachenInnovativeSolutionsMember_20140731" decimals="-5" scale="6">15.0</ix:nonFraction> million based on the achievement of CE Mark approval in the European Union and a revenue-based milestone related to the development of the future Impella ECP<sup style="font-size:85%;line-height:120%;vertical-align:top">TM</sup> expandable catheter pump technology. These potential milestone payments may be made, at the Company&#8217;s option, by a combination of cash or Company common stock.&#160;As of December 31, 2019, the Company used a combination of an income approach, based on various revenue and cost assumptions and applying a probability to each outcome and a Monte-Carlo valuation model. For the clinical and regulatory milestone, probabilities were applied to each potential scenario and the resulting values were discounted using a rate that considers the weighted average cost of capital as well as a specific risk premium associated with the riskiness of the earn out itself, the related projections, and the overall business. The revenue-based milestone is valued using a Monte-Carlo valuation model, which simulates estimated future revenues during the earn out-period using management's best estimates. Projected revenues are based on the Company&#8217;s most recent internal operational budgets and long-range strategic plans.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Fair Value Hierarchy</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Fair value is defined as the price that would be received upon the sale of an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. Financial assets and liabilities carried at fair value are to be classified and disclosed in one of the following three categories:</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:4.54%;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 1: Quoted market prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:4.54%;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 2: Observable market-based inputs or unobservable inputs that are corroborated by market data.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:4.54%;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 3: Unobservable inputs that are not corroborated by market data.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 1 primarily consists of financial instruments whose values are based on quoted market prices such as exchange-traded instruments and listed equities.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 2 includes financial instruments that are valued using models or other valuation methodologies. These models are primarily industry-standard models that consider various assumptions, including time value, yield curve, volatility factors, prepayment speeds, default rates, loss severity, current market and contractual prices for the underlying financial instruments, as well as other relevant economic measures. Substantially all of these assumptions are observable in the marketplace, can be derived from observable data or are supported by observable levels at which transactions are executed in the marketplace.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 3 is comprised of unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity. Financial assets are considered Level 3 when their fair values are determined using pricing models, discounted cash flows or similar techniques and at least one significant model assumption or input is unobservable.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
</ix:continuation><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">14</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:continuation id="F_000447_dcnt_f5175ad7-8a37-4784-9aa4-3ca688b268ac" continuedAt="F_000447_dcnt_59a972e8-26b1-4738-8841-28192c7a9e6f"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000467" name="us-gaap:FairValueAssetsMeasuredOnRecurringAndNonrecurringBasisTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following tables presents the Company&#8217;s fair value hierarchy for its financial instruments measured at fair value as of December 31, 2019 and March 31, 2019:</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>
<div>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:auto;border-collapse:collapse; width:90%;">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:50.6%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.12%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:10.16%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 1</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.12%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:10.36%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 2</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.12%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:10.16%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 3</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.12%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company has determined that the estimated fair value of its money market funds and its investment in Shockwave Medical, a publicly traded medical device company, are reported as Level 1 financial assets as they are valued at quoted market prices in active markets. The investment in Shockwave Medical is classified within other assets in the consolidated balance sheet.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company has determined that the estimated fair value of its repurchase agreements, U.S. Treasury mutual fund securities, government-backed securities, corporate debt securities, commercial paper and cross-currency rate swap are reported as Level 2 financial assets as they are based on model-driven valuations in which all significant inputs are observable, or can be derived from or corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the asset.</p>
</ix:continuation><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">15</p>

</table></div></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The change in fair value of the contingent consideration was primarily due to estimates related to development timelines and the passage of time on the fair value measurement of milestones. Adjustments associated with the change in fair value of contingent consideration are included in research and development expenses in the Company&#8217;s consolidated statements of operations. Significant increases or decreases in any of the probabilities of success or changes in expected timelines for achievement of any of these milestones could result in a significantly higher or lower fair value of the liability. The fair value of the contingent consideration at each reporting date is updated by reflecting the changes in fair value reflected in the Company&#8217;s consolidated statement of operations. There is no assurance that any of the conditions for the milestone payments will be met<span style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;color:#000000;">.</span>&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:5pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:5pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;text-indent:6.67%;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">16</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000448" name="us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="margin-top:8pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 6. Property and Equipment</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000470" name="us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:12pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000449" name="abmd:GoodwillInProcessResearchAndDevelopmentAndOtherAssetsTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000449_dcnt_410d9078-d20d-4742-a90f-c57af4f1e0c6">
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note&#160;7. Goodwill, In-Process Research and Development and Other Assets</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Goodwill</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The carrying amount of goodwill at December 31, 2019 and March 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000739" name="us-gaap:Goodwill" contextRef="C_0000815094_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">32.6</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000740" name="us-gaap:Goodwill" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">32.6</ix:nonFraction> million, respectively, and has been recorded in connection with the Company&#8217;s acquisition of Impella Cardiosystems AG, in May 2005 and ECP and AIS in July 2014. <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000471" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfGoodwillTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000471_cnt_1">The carrying value of goodwill and the change in the balance for the nine months ended December 31, 2019 are as follows:</ix:nonNumeric></p><ix:continuation id="F_000471_cnt_1">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company evaluates goodwill at least annually at October 31, as well as whenever events or changes in circumstances suggest that the carrying amount may not be recoverable. The Company has <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000744" name="us-gaap:GoodwillImpairedAccumulatedImpairmentLoss" contextRef="C_0000815094_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" scale="6">no</ix:nonFraction> accumulated impairment losses on goodwill.</p>
<p style="margin-top:18pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In-Process Research &#38; Development</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The carrying amount of in-process research &#38; development, or IPR&#38;D, assets at December 31, 2019 and March 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000745" name="us-gaap:IndefiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsExcludingGoodwill" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapBusinessAcquisitionAxis_abmdEcpEntwickslungsgesellschaftMbhMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000746" name="us-gaap:IndefiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsExcludingGoodwill" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapBusinessAcquisitionAxis_abmdEcpEntwickslungsgesellschaftMbhMember_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">15.2</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> million for each date, respectively, and was recorded in conjunction with the Company&#8217;s acquisition of ECP and AIS, in July 2014. The estimated fair value of IPR&#38;D assets at the acquisition date was determined using a probability-weighted income approach, which discounts expected future cash flows to present value. The projected cash flow estimates for the future Impella ECP<sup style="font-size:85%;line-height:120%;vertical-align:top">TM</sup> expandable catheter pump technology was based on certain key assumptions, including estimates of future revenue and expenses, taking into account the stage of development of the technology at the acquisition date and the time and resources needed to complete development. The Company used an original discount rate of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000747" name="us-gaap:AlternativeInvestmentMeasurementInput" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapBusinessAcquisitionAxis_abmdEcpEntwickslungsgesellschaftMbhMember_us-gaapMeasurementInputTypeAxis_us-gaapMeasurementInputDiscountRateMember_20191231" decimals="2" scale="-2">21</ix:nonFraction>% and cash flows that have been probability adjusted to reflect the risks of product commercialization, which the Company believes is appropriate and representative of market participant assumptions.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000472" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfIndefiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The carrying value of the Company&#8217;s IPR&#38;D assets and the change in the balance for the nine months ended December 31, 2019 are as follows:</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company evaluates IPR&#38;D assets at least annually at October 31, as well as whenever events or changes in circumstances suggest that the carrying amount may not be recoverable. <p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:8pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Equity Method Investment and Other Investments<span style="font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;"> </span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company periodically makes investments in medical device companies that focus on heart failure, heart pump and other medical device technologies. For investments in convertible debt or preferred stock securities that do not have readily determinable market values, the Company measures these investments at cost minus impairment, if any, plus or minus changes resulting from observable price changes in orderly transactions for an identical or similar investment. The Company measures investments in equity securities at fair value and recognize changes in fair value in net income. For equity method investments, the amount of the Company&#8217;s initial investment is adjusted each period by the Company&#8217;s share of the investee&#8217;s income or loss. <span style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;color:#000000;">The Company monitors any events or changes in circumstances that may have a significant effect on the fair value of investments, either due to impairment or based on observable price changes, and makes any necessary adjustments. </span> </p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000474" name="abmd:ScheduleOfEquityMethodAndOtherInvestmentsTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following table summarizes the Company&#8217;s equity method and other investments as of December 31, 2019 and March 31, 2019, which are classified as<span style="font-style:italic;"> </span>other assets in the consolidated balance sheets:</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:5pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:5pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;">In fiscal 2019, the Company invested $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000780" name="us-gaap:InvestmentsInAffiliatesSubsidiariesAssociatesAndJointVentures" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_abmdShockwaveMedicalMember_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">25.0</ix:nonFraction> million in Shockwave Medical. The fair value of this investment as of December 31, 2019 and March 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000781" name="us-gaap:InvestmentsFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_abmdShockwaveMedicalMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">73.7</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000782" name="us-gaap:InvestmentsFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_abmdShockwaveMedicalMember_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">56.2</ix:nonFraction> million, respectively. The Company recognized a pre-tax unrealized gain of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000784" name="us-gaap:UnrealizedGainLossOnInvestments" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_abmdShockwaveMedicalMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">23.5</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000783" name="us-gaap:UnrealizedGainLossOnInvestments" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_abmdShockwaveMedicalMember_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">17.5</ix:nonFraction> million on its investment in Shockwave Medical for the three and nine months ended December 31, 2019, respectively.</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In July 2019, the Company invested $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000785" name="us-gaap:EquityMethodInvestments" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_abmdMedicalDeviceCompaniesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.0</ix:nonFraction> million in a small private medical device company. Based on the Company&#8217;s controlling economic interest and significant influence exertion over the investee&#8217;s operating and financial policies, this investment was accounted for using the equity method. The Company recognizes its share of the results of operations related to this equity method investment one quarter in arrears when the results of the entity become available, in other income (expense), net of tax in the condensed consolidated statement of operations. The Company's share of income statement activity for this equity method investment for the three and nine months ended December 31, 2019 was a loss of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000786" name="us-gaap:EquityMethodInvestmentOtherThanTemporaryImpairment" contextRef="C_0000815094_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000787" name="us-gaap:EquityMethodInvestmentOtherThanTemporaryImpairment" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">0.1</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> million.</p>
</ix:continuation><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">18</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:continuation id="F_000449_dcnt_acd5467a-d43e-4a63-8da8-e3efff3758dc">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">During the nine months ended December 31, 2019, the Company made additional other investments of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000788" name="us-gaap:OtherInvestments" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_abmdMedicalDeviceCompaniesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">16.6</ix:nonFraction> million in other private medical device companies.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:18pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Other Intangible Assets and Other</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Included within other intangible assets and other assets is $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000789" name="abmd:OtherIntangibleAssetsAndOtherAssets" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_abmdLicenseManufacturingRightsToTechnologyMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">4.1</ix:nonFraction> million related to license manufacturing rights to certain technology from third parties. These intangible assets are classified with other assets in the Company&#8217;s consolidated balance sheet and are amortized over their useful life of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000790" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetUsefulLife" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_us-gaapOtherIntangibleAssetsMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:duryear">15</ix:nonNumeric> years.</p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000450" name="us-gaap:LeasesOfLesseeDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000450_dcnt_d291d870-ed13-45d9-a0c0-5934d0945b2c">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:18pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note&#160;8. Leases</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company has lease agreements for real estate including corporate offices, warehouse space, vehicles and certain office equipment. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">At the inception of a contractual arrangement, the Company determines whether it contains a lease by assessing whether there is an identified asset and whether the contract conveys the right to control the use of the identified asset in exchange for consideration over a period of time. If both criteria are met, the Company calculates the associated lease liability and corresponding right-of-use, or ROU, asset upon lease commencement. Operating lease assets and liabilities are recognized based on the present value of minimum lease payments over the lease term using an appropriate discount rate. ROU assets also include any lease payments made at or before lease commencement and any initial direct costs incurred and exclude any lease incentives received.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The discount rate used is the rate that the Company would have to pay to borrow on a collateralized basis over a similar term for an amount equal to the lease payments in a similar economic environment. At the lease commencement date, the discount rate implicit in the lease is used to discount the lease liability, if readily determinable.&#160;&#160;If not readily determinable or lease do not contain an implicit rate, the Company&#8217;s incremental borrowing rate is used as the discount rate. Discount rates are updated when there is a new lease or a modification to an existing lease, and the methodology is reassessed annually. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company records operating lease liabilities within current liabilities or long-term liabilities based upon the length of time associated with the lease payments. The Company records its operating lease ROU assets as long-term assets. Leases with an initial term of 12 months or less are not recognized on the consolidated balance sheet. The Company have elected the practical expedient where lease agreements with lease and non-lease components are accounted for as a single lease component for all assets. The Company&#8217;s financing leases are not material to our financial statements.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000459" name="us-gaap:LesseeLeasesPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000459_dcnt_79ab7aac-98d0-42f1-808a-2a25c73bf3cb">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company adopted ASC Topic 842 on April 1, 2019 using the optional transition method. As such, the disclosures required under ASC Topic 842 are not presented for periods before the date of adoption. For the comparative period prior to adoption, the Company presents the disclosures which were previously required under ASC Topic 840. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company elected the package of transitional practical expedients for leases existing prior to the adoption date. The Company did not reassess whether existing contracts are or contain leases, leases retained their historical lease classification and initial direct costs were not reassessed for capitalization under the new standard. Operating lease assets and operating lease liabilities were recognized based on the present value of minimum lease payments over the remaining lease term as of the adoption date. </p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000476" name="abmd:ScheduleOfSupplementalBalanceSheetInformationTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:4.54%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following table presents supplemental balance sheet information related to our operating leases:</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000794" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" contextRef="C_0000815094_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">12,621</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="middle" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Expense charged to operations under operating leases was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000795" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseCost" contextRef="C_0000815094_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">1.2</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000796" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseCost" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.2</ix:nonFraction> million during the three and nine months ended December 31, 2019, respectively. Short-term lease expenses were not material.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:3pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:3pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Under ASC Topic 840, Leases (&#8220;ASC 840&#8221;), the Company recognized rent expense on a straight-line basis over the term of the lease and recorded the difference between the amount charged to expense and the rent paid as prepaid rent or deferred rent liability. As of March 31, 2019, the amount of deferred rent was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000797" name="us-gaap:DeferredRentCredit" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">0.3</ix:nonFraction> million, which was subsequently reclassified as contra-asset against the ROU asset upon adoption of ASU No. 2016-02 on April 1, 2019. </p>
</ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">19</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:continuation id="F_000450_dcnt_d291d870-ed13-45d9-a0c0-5934d0945b2c"><ix:continuation id="F_000459_dcnt_79ab7aac-98d0-42f1-808a-2a25c73bf3cb"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000477" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityMaturityTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Maturities of operating lease liabilities as of December 31, 2019 are as follows:</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<div>

<td valign="middle" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:20.26%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Employee compensation consists primarily of accrued bonuses, commissions, employee benefits and, payroll taxes at December 31, 2019 and March 31, 2019.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:12pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">20</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000452" name="us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 10. Stockholders&#8217; Equity</p>
<p style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;margin-left:1.33%;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Stock Repurchase Program</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;Background-color:#FFFFFF;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In August 2019, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors authorized a stock repurchase program for up to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000832" name="us-gaap:StockRepurchaseProgramAuthorizedAmount1" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190831" decimals="-5" scale="6">200.0</ix:nonFraction> million of shares of its common stock. Under this stock repurchase program, the Company is authorized to repurchase shares through open market purchases, privately negotiated transactions or otherwise in accordance with applicable federal securities laws, including through Rule 10b5-1 trading plans and under Rule 10b-18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;). The stock repurchase program has no time limit and may be suspended for periods or discontinued at any time. The Company is funding the stock repurchase program with its available cash and marketable securities. Through December 31, 2019, the Company has repurchased a total of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000833" name="us-gaap:StockRepurchasedDuringPeriodShares" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">318,361</ix:nonFraction> shares for $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000834" name="us-gaap:StockRepurchasedDuringPeriodValue" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" decimals="-3" scale="6">59.9</ix:nonFraction> million under the stock repurchase program. The remaining authorization under the stock repurchase program was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000835" name="us-gaap:StockRepurchaseProgramRemainingAuthorizedRepurchaseAmount1" contextRef="C_0000815094_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">140.1</ix:nonFraction> million as of December 31, 2019.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000480" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfTreasuryStockByClassTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;Background-color:#FFFFFF;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following table provides share repurchase activities:</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;Background-color:#FFFFFF;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Stock options generally vest and become exercisable annually over <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000923" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardAwardVestingPeriod1" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">three years</ix:nonNumeric>. The remaining unrecognized stock-based compensation expense for unvested stock option awards at December 31, 2019 was approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000924" name="us-gaap:EmployeeServiceShareBasedCompensationNonvestedAwardsTotalCompensationCostNotYetRecognized" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapAwardTypeAxis_us-gaapEmployeeStockOptionMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">15.2</ix:nonFraction> million and the estimated weighted-average period over which this cost will be recognized is <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000925" name="us-gaap:EmployeeServiceShareBasedCompensationNonvestedAwardsTotalCompensationCostNotYetRecognizedPeriodForRecognition1" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapAwardTypeAxis_us-gaapEmployeeStockOptionMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:duryear">2.0</ix:nonNumeric> years.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The aggregate intrinsic value of options exercised was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000926" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardOptionsExercisesInPeriodTotalIntrinsicValue" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">12.2</ix:nonFraction> million for the nine months ended December 31, 2019. The total cash received as a result of employee stock option exercises for the nine months ended December 31, 2019 was approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000927" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromStockOptionsExercised" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.2</ix:nonFraction> million.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company estimates the fair value of each stock option granted at the grant date using the Black-Scholes option valuation model. <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000484" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfShareBasedPaymentAwardStockOptionsValuationAssumptionsTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000484_cnt_1">The weighted average grant-date fair values and weighted average assumptions used in the calculation of fair value of options granted during the three and nine months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018 was as follows:</ix:nonNumeric></p><ix:continuation id="F_000484_cnt_1">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Restricted stock units generally vest annually over <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000954" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardAwardVestingPeriod1" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapAwardTypeAxis_us-gaapRestrictedStockUnitsRSUMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">three years</ix:nonNumeric>. The remaining unrecognized compensation expense for outstanding restricted stock units, including performance awards, as of December 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000955" name="us-gaap:EmployeeServiceShareBasedCompensationNonvestedAwardsTotalCompensationCostNotYetRecognized" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapAwardTypeAxis_us-gaapRestrictedStockUnitsRSUMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">41.1</ix:nonFraction> million and the estimated weighted-average period over which this cost will be recognized is <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000956" name="us-gaap:EmployeeServiceShareBasedCompensationNonvestedAwardsTotalCompensationCostNotYetRecognizedPeriodForRecognition1" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapAwardTypeAxis_us-gaapRestrictedStockUnitsRSUMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:duryear">1.8</ix:nonNumeric> years.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The weighted average grant-date fair value for restricted stock units granted during the nine months ended December 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD_xbrlishares" id="F_000957" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardEquityInstrumentsOtherThanOptionsGrantsInPeriodWeightedAverageGrantDateFairValue" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapAwardTypeAxis_us-gaapRestrictedStockUnitsRSUMember_20190401_20191231" decimals="2">260.13</ix:nonFraction>. The total fair value of restricted stock units vested during the nine months ended December 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000958" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardEquityInstrumentsOtherThanOptionsVestedInPeriodTotalFairValue" contextRef="C_0000815094_us-gaapAwardTypeAxis_us-gaapRestrictedStockUnitsRSUMember_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">99.1</ix:nonFraction> million.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:18pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:4.54%;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Performance-Based Awards</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In May 2019, performance-based awards of restricted stock units for the potential issuance of up to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000959" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardEquityInstrumentsOtherThanOptionsGrantsInPeriod" contextRef="C_0000815094_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_us-gaapAwardTypeAxis_abmdPerformanceBasedRestrictedStockUnitsMember_20190501_20190531" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">196,580</ix:nonFraction> shares of common stock were issued to certain executive officers and employees, which vest upon achievement of prescribed service milestones by the award recipients and the achievement of prescribed performance milestones by the Company. As of December 31, 2019, the Company is recognizing compensation expense based on the probable outcome related to the prescribed performance targets on the outstanding awards.</p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000454" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000454_dcnt_b362b41c-04a9-4be9-937c-99c43629c319">
<p style="margin-top:18pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note&#160;12. Income Taxes</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s income tax provision was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000960" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="C_0000815094_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">27.8</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000961" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="C_0000815094_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">19.6</ix:nonFraction> million for the three months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018, respectively. <span style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;color:#000000;">The Company&#8217;s income tax provision was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000962" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">46.3</ix:nonFraction> million for the nine months ended December 31, 2019 and the Company had an income tax benefit of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000963" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="C_0000815094_20180401_20181231" decimals="-5" sign="-" scale="6">20.2</ix:nonFraction> million for the nine months ended December 31, 2018. </span>The Company&#8217;s effective&#160;tax&#160;rate was&#160;<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000964" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="C_0000815094_20191001_20191231" decimals="3" scale="-2">28.7</ix:nonFraction>%&#160;and <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000965" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="C_0000815094_20181001_20181231" decimals="3" scale="-2">30.5</ix:nonFraction>% for the three months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018, respectively. The Company&#8217;s effective tax rate was <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000966" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" decimals="3" scale="-2">21.3</ix:nonFraction>%&#160;and (<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000967" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="C_0000815094_20180401_20181231" decimals="3" sign="-" scale="-2">12.3</ix:nonFraction>)% for the nine months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018<span style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;color:#000000;">, respectively</span>. </p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000486" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfEffectiveIncomeTaxRateReconciliationTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000815094_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;Background-color:#FFFFFF;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The significant differences between the statutory income tax rate and effective income tax rate for the three and nine months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018 were as follows: </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>
<div>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:auto;border-collapse:collapse; width:90%;">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:43.42%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.4%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
